physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bilateral multiple lung nodules (maximum diameter 1.2 cm) and multiple thyroid nodules (measuring from 0.3 to 0.5 cm in diameter).

Surveillance CT scan showed 166 nodules measuring 2 to 17 mm in diameter across 5 lobes of the lung, including pure ground glass nodules (GGN), partial-solid nodules, solid nodules, and cavitary nodules. One of the largest lesions in the left upper lobe became progressively solid.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The largest lesion progressed to a solid state.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Left-upper lobectomy revealed 3 major lesions classified as invasive adenocarcinoma, 4 as atypical adenomatous hyperplasia, and 13 as adenocarcinoma in situ.
